overview: Jaina Wald has a diverse business development background including marketing communications and editorial experience working with national media organizations. Prior to joining Landmark, Jaina worked for a number of news publications including serving on the editorial staff of a New York Times subsidiary and The St. Louis Post-Dispatch. Jaina was previously a key member of Washington University’s Alumni and Admissions group where she communicated with presenters and students in developing strategic plans for national customer outreach and education. Her prior experience includes Co-founding and directing marketing efforts for an established community organization offering wide-scale service opportunities in the St. Louis area. At Landmark, Jaina is responsible for directing strategic operational efforts around technology services for an array of account relationships across the Fortune 500 and internal Technology Accounts. Jaina graduated with honors from Washington University in St. Louis with a B.A. in English and concentration in Spanish and attended the prestigious immersion program at Pontificia Universidad Catolica de Chile in Santiago, Chile.
